jobDescription: Space Planner - CAD AssistantLocation: Washington, DC Employment Type: Full Time Regular Description: Support operations staff, Client Representatives and Construction Managers in the development of space plans and designs from blueprints or sketches. Responsibilities:Prepare designs and layouts to include site plans, floor plans, furniture/equipment plans, interior and exterior elevations and related sections and details utilizing a computer with industry-specific software, to include AutoCAD and GIZA.Complete diagrams, schedules, design sketches, presentation drawings, working drawings and other computer-generated or hand-drafted documents from prepared drawings for client use.Organize, layout and coordinate drafted documents.Possess a working knowledge or architectural symbols and graphic standards.Assist in the development of presentations for customer such as furniture specifications, fabrics and finishes, proposals, as well as pricing.Maintain working relationship with Client Representatives and Construction Managers.Accompany in-house staff to meetings with the customer as required, attend and participate in design presentations for special projects, conduct field surveys and document existing conditions required to complete project documents.Provide administrative and day-to-day operational support including coordination/completion of job filesQualifications:Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university; or three to five years of related experience, preferably in the systems furniture industry, desirable; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Experience with work space/office design.Knowledge of AutoCAD/GIZA, Excel, MS Windows.
